thread.title: Twenty One Pilots strip down to underwear before accepting Grammy Award
thread.title_full: Twenty One Pilots strip down to underwear before accepting Grammy Award

author: USA TODAY
title: Twenty One Pilots strip down to underwear before accepting Grammy Award

organizations.name: best pop duo group performance twenty one pilots

text:
Twenty One Pilots strip down to underwear before accepting Grammy Award Sara M Moniuszko , USA TODAY 9:54   
Josh Dun, left, andTyler Joseph of the musical group Twenty One Pilots arrive at the 59th annual Grammy Awards. (Photo: Jordan Strauss, Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) 
Are you watching the Grammys in your underwear? 
Twenty One Pilots took to the stage to accept their award for best pop duo/group performance for Stressed Out -- but not before they stripped off their pants. 
Twenty One Pilots are team #NoPants at the 2017 Grammy Awards. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images for NARAS) 
While on stage, the music duo explained that the bold move was inspired by watching the Grammy Awards in 2016 before they were famous. 
“Josh turned to me -- and we were no one at that time -- he turned to me and he said, ‘If we ever go to the Grammys, if we ever win a Grammy, we should receive it just like this,’” Tyler Joseph said. 
Finishing on an inspirational note, he concluded, "Anyone, from anywhere, can do anything. And this is that." 
Twenty One Pilots accept Best Pop Duo Group Performance Twenty One Pilots without their pants on. (Photo: Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK) Facebook
